" type tactical firefighting gameplay . matches consist one two types game types . first probably most popular type bomb defusal . both game types , you win either eliminating opposing team or following objective . bomb defusal random player team receive bomb each round . player plant bomb one two bomb spots or simply drop bomb teammate pick it up use it . once bomb planted counter-terrorists must defuse it regardless if terrorists eliminated . counter-terrorists usually thirty-five seconds defuse bomb win round . second type gameplay hostage rescue . terrorists must protect four hostages area map counter-terrorists rescuing them taking them their base . if hostages killed terrorists or counter-terrorists , nothing happen except now counter-terrorists must completely kill terrorists gain victory round . start each round all players few seconds quickly buy weapons money they achieved past rounds victories . both teams significant difference arsenal weapons you choose , but neither really focuses specific time gun style . all weapons game one-hundred percent realistic deadly reality . this element makes counter-strike such superior game . counter-strike without argument most popular online action game world . entire culture formed around it . so what makes it such extremely addictive popular game ? it purely because fantastically well-crafted gameplay not graphics , or game would not popular it . players around world give you many " deep " reasons why it such great game . but one without argument stands out . it simply fact versus other games , it " difficult " make kill game . what makes game so addicting pleasure killing someone after long thirty second gunfight or quick shot head , knowing dead player now experiencing some form anger he waits out rest round . element how realistic guns feel game . regardless if they fake shooting totally simulated , it superiorly well . definitely once new player game gained enough experience achieve kills least periodically , feeling " power " experienced when holding ak-47 or m4 . game quite punishing new players , total hapzard players who never played first-person shooters or video games all . but regardless stress you feel first , there absolutely no reason put down game because entry-difficulty , it almost guaranteed you get better game . there over ten maps game , each one masterpiece . all maps wildly differ each other feel action even environment . most popular all maps , de_dust2 created davej , still commonly referenced many gaming parodies , magazines , shows , etc . due its style simplicity , it godly-designed map arguably most popular map first-person shooter history . one thing helps fight player bored game simply maps . since each map superbly designed , player could easily switch one after bored continue play , different feel . game also many public map editors which 3rd parties use create custom maps . fy_iceworld awp_map some very popular maps created amateur designers . this makes counter-strike game almost " infinite " value sort feel . sound counter-strike absolutely insanely-realistic . first time player plays or even watches player play game , person definitely without doubt notice clear sounds ak-47 fire or pistol fire . not much known why guns sound so realistic , player best guess designers actually recorded live gunfire weapons . sound weapons combined look feel ; end up making player totally immersed into game feeling " power " . this sort thing extremely rare video game . time counter-strike simply jaw-dropping graphics . created all half-life engine , players amazed lighting effects how clear textures . present , game doesn't hold same , but it what past mattered . half-life one first games history some slightly complex dynamic physics . bouncing flashbang or player blown away also something time look . games before release half-life hardly any sort physics , if they , it would something game ) . after two excellent games , our favorite elfin friend his furry sidekick come last entry jak trilogy . big question : it good ending ? i'm pleased say overall , yes . jak 3 takes place undetermined time after conclusion jak 2 . haven city become divided after relentless attacks robots , metal heads other nasties . population blames jak these problems he finds himself flown out wasteland , harsh unforgiving desert where nobody survive without help . abandoned those he saved , jak his buddy daxter set out thier final adventure . like it two predecessors , jak 3 platforming game combined gun shooter . you get various jumps , kicks , punches leaps , you also get wide array firearms take out your foes when your fancy kung-fu karate aren't enough . jak moves remain largely unchanged jak 2 ( which now called j2 ) . he still punch like man , jump like kangaroo , leap like bullfrog . gunplay remains pretty much same well . you get four guns ( blaster , rifle , machine gun peacemaker ) , but nice twist , each weapon gets various upgrades game goes . rifle example , starts out it default setting . hower , next upgrade allows it shoot richochet bullets while third upgrade gives it flying platform shoots bullets all directions . each gun three upgrades playing them blast . peace maker example , fire shot paralyzes all enemies makes them float around ( whee ! ) while it final upgrade ... well , let just say you'll shooting mini-nukes lo t.t he biggest change jak game play comes form vehicles . while j2 flying vehicles zoomers , jak 3 cars ( not nice , talking pixar kind ) . because half game set desert , jak daxter get around dune buggies . there eight them each various unique traits . some really , really fast , one jump riddiculously high ( wheee ! ) some them spin out control slightest twitch control stick ( boo ! ) . you'll spending lot time driving buggies most part , it enjoyable fun , though some them ( such sand shark ) bit difficult handle . new feature jak 3 sheer size it . j1 j2 two enormous areas run around . here , you not one , not two , but three , yes , three ! gigantic areas run around . like previous games , there no loading times , astonishing feat considering how enormous both worlds ( spargus city , wasteland haven city ) . you'll definatly see lot amazing sights during your trips throughout jak 3 world ( such how haven city ... ahem ... changed since last game ) . dark jak powers return well , but now balanced new side our hero ... light jak . if dark jak attacking force , light jak defensive force . dark allows you kill things really quickly , while light allows you heal , fly ( this so awesome ! ) , surround yourself inpenetrable shield , even slow down time crawl . both powers activated any time long you light dark eco your meters . very nice touch , you stop light or dark touch button save your energy when you really need it . while both light dark come into play vital moments during gameplay , both really just little added bonus spice up gameplay when you want , you play throughout game without needing use either force ( except scripted moments where you need ) . but then again , able heal yourself whenever you want very handy thing ! * smile*like j2 , jak 3 you going place place , talking people doing what they tell you . when you finish , you head over next person what they want , etc . it linear system makes it easy tell where go what next it sounds fairly restrictive , but it one big strength : you don't start next mission until you want . if you want , you wander around wasteland blowing up wanderers twenty hours , go hunt down twelve precurser orbs watch sun go up down three times , then tackle mission . this free roaming system allows you what you'd like if you don't feel like doing missions while . one thing i'd like address before we go any further difficulty level . if one takes look my review j2 , one find lot anger hatred directed towards naughty dog making j2 most unnecessarily hardest game i've ever played ( it still way , tied only spider man ps2 ) . i am very pleased naughty dog towned down difficulty lot jak 3 . no longer each every mission require twenty attempts before you pass it , no longer you throwing controller into tv while screaming obscenities becuase a**hole errol won fricken race again . here , difficulty seems just right . not too hard , not too easy . most missions require few attempts before they completed , few finished one try . there still few quite difficult , one or two grit-your-teeth inducing , but overall , nothing infuriating many moments previous entry series . oh , there only few " go through ring " missions this time around . thank goodness . addition free-roaming gameplay , there also plenty secrets unlock this quest . there over 600 precurser orbs find collect jak 3 , doing so you get unlock various features such unlimited dark light jak power , invincibility , extra vehicles , various weapon upgrades , etc . while some hidden behind corners , many these orbs collected doing various challenges people throw your way , such searching around paticular area , going through rings ( grumbles ) , following little blue light even stopping time . there plenty things get those little shiny orbs , but results well worth it . addition , jak 3 arguably best moments series terms " wow " factor . consoles . madden nfl 07 brings back practically every feature madden 06 . top , number new gameplay upgrades brought table , majority which available all versions game . themselves , none these individual changes or upgrades particularly game changing , but taken whole , they add nice dimension depth . these features include highlight stick , new kick meter , lead blocking controls . highlight stick new version truck stick used runners offense . here , you use right control stick pull off sorts crazy jukes steps star running backs so well known , top , depending type back you're playing , you opt use more-powerful moves , or more finesse-based maneuvers . this feels like natural evolution last year truck stick , though most experienced madden players able get just easily using button-based moves rather than making liberal use stick . but if you take time learn stick figure out how use it button controls together , you very hard runner stop . new lead blocking controls likely inspire some new tactics all types players . here , while offense , you opt switch your controlled player any available blockers during running play . this includes offensive linemen , tight ends , fullbacks , or whoever else might blocking play . when blocking , you just standard blocks , or you even get dirty some mean-spirited cut blocks . this interesting mechanic , because it stops you rely cpu blockers , which any experienced player tell you , not always most reliable players field . you also quickly switch back control running back once you've laid down your block , which good , because cpu running back doesn't always manage find holes you're creating . first , you may find yourself unable effectively use this feature , setting up right blocks isn't always most intuitive thing world . but after some time , this control method gives running game really interesting new perspective , those who love finding new strategies bound eat this up . new kick meter probably most accurate representation kicking available game thus far . this meter , you use typical arrow line up your angle then press down right analog stick set up your power . meter quickly fills up , then you press forward right stick set power well your accuracy . accuracy based angle which you press up . if you press too far right or left , kick get away you . if you land it within set space , it go pretty much right where you want it . beyond , changes 06 07 mostly ancillary , fundamentally , game plays very much its predecessor . defense , there few more available options terms positioning your defensive players , you commit your defense certain direction moment ball snapped . offense , quarterback vision cone , which made its debut last year , still available , though it not required feature . you just tap right analog stick after snapping ball , it pop , letting you use it little accuracy boost . no , it not any more fun use than it last year , but that not altogether surprising . otherwise , pretty much every control feature you've come expect madden front center once again . potentially , some people could play through madden 07 never really partake new running control features , but there definitely enough all available upgrades add significant layer depth experience . even though madden nfl 07 doesn't any big , game-changing features make it especially memorable iteration series , its roster small , but useful changes ultimately more compelling than anything madden 06 offer last year . while some people undoubtedly over notion playing new games old consoles , madden 07 shows it still deliver some enjoyable football , regardless what platform it . it not big step forward , similarities this year last year might tough sell some . but it those similar aspects madden 07 ultimately improves upon over its predecessor , if you skipped out 06 , then there no good reason ignore 07 .	1

i can't get enough okami ! i've beaten it am started second play-though . any action-rpg game fan least try this game ! title basically says it all . it typically japanese play words , since , depending how you translate it , " okami " mean either " wolf " or " king gods " . those people whom not enough information really understand game , here basics : 100 years before game beginning , huge 8-headed dragon monster called orochi menaced small village kamiki . after suffering orochi tyranny years , village champion , nagi , white wolf village dubbed shiranui , defeated orochi . shiranui died his wounds after fight , village built shrine him . peace reigned 100 years , until evil suddenly mysteriously reappeared ... you control shiranui reborn quest save land evil . you travel all over land nippon ( which japanese " japan " ; how original ) fighting monsters , helping people , healing nature curse evil . story nothing new , both very linear quite predictable . but it very well , mixing japanese mythology into classic hero story , generous helping humor give it flavor . story one major downside , though : it told through cut scenes contain bucket-loads exposition . you often find yourself button-mashing desperately try speed things , not work very well because important cut scenes don't let you speed up dialogue . instance , very first cut scene opens game literally takes least 15 minutes get through before you get action . most rest not nearly long , but several them take good 5 minutes least . say it gets tedious understatement . still , cell-shaded graphics largely make up tedious cut scenes . they very beautiful , yet simplistic style evokes traditional japanese ink painting . despite simple style , though , level detail outstanding . fact , it so detailed there occasional spot graphical slowdown . this game really pushes hardware ps2 its limits . music sound also fantastic . most music evokes traditional japanese art much graphics , while sound effects range wolf barks footfalls wind blowing gently through trees , more . mood always set perfectly whatever environment you're visiting . except , possibly , voices . rather than real voices , people talk form gibberish sounds like someone trying talk underwater . while it not bother me personally , some people simply not listen these voice effects . either you'll hate voice noises passion , or you won't care all . either way , this not good point game . controls take bit getting used , but when you gotten used them they become second nature . unlike " legend zelda " games , there no enemy lock-on during combat . instead , you automatically target closest monster(s ) when you push attack button . this simplifies combat without turning it into button-mashing cake walk . it works perfectly ... unless you get hit controller bug . yes , * bug * game . thankfully rare , i only encountered it twice 60+ hours game play . still , when it happens it extremely annoying . during combat , while you're wailing away monster , options-menu suddenly open no reason . usually , analog control your controller also go crazy , either just turning off or madly flickering off . either case makes game impossible play , course , since you control your in-game avatar left analog stick . first case easy fix ; just turn analog control back exit menu . second case , you only fix it literally unplugging controller then plugging it back . far more common than controller bug load times . they usually not terrible , but it seems like loading screen comes up least every five minutes or so . these long cut-scenes , you might sometimes wonder if there actually any game play included . but there * * game play , it lot fun . there great deal keep you occupied , compelling story line many treasure hunts , races , puzzles , mini-games . fighting save world , you go fishing , feed animals , catch thieves , lot more . plus , after you beat game once it unlocks lots extras , including image galleries sound track . all wonderful atmosphere definitely make this game worth checking out . rent it before you buy it , if possible , make sure you deal long cut scenes , numerous load times , weird voice effects . but if you fan action rpgs like " legend zelda " , you definitely want add okami your game library . summary : pros : - great story- great graphics- great music/sound- wonderful atmosphere- lots culture mythology give it flavor- plentiful activities mini-games- unlockable extras after beating gamecons : - occasional graphic slowdown- too much exposition- tedious cut-scenes- lots load times- rare controller bugneutral : - voice noises you might or might not hateover-all score : five stars fun-fun-fun ! but three stars over all because many problems	1

after sixteen long years , final fantasy iii finally sees official release outside japan . however , unlike previous games , final fantasy iii completely reworked . this more than just port enhanced graphics . final fantasy iii includes some new secrets side quests addition its graphical overhaul . final fantasy iii may just enough please some hardcore fans , but wait really worth it ? well , yes , but game isn't perfect . storyline final fantasy iii entirely too simple . crystals losing their powers there only four warriors come forth save world falling into darkness . sixteen years ago this pretty standard story , but when compared your average rpg today , current final fantasy games , storyline final fantasy iii joke . there nothing this story screams epic , characters involved aren't developed very well . luckily , we let it slide because its sixteen years old . gameplay wise , final fantasy iii pretty similar most rpgs today . you'll go roaming through dungeons towns getting into random battles . there few quirks game ds utilizes . you'll find moments where you'll zoom into certain objects you examine . it should also noted you use touch screen almost exclusively game . using stylus you make your character run direction you want him , gliding it across screen . taping things makes your character examine it , ultimately this how you open chests talk people . it works out , but it feels really clumbsy times . if you're looking get through dungeon little hassle , just stick directional buttons . its credit , though , using stylus makes menu navigation much faster , but most part , stylus controls just feel tacked . combat traditional turn based combat . there no atb gauge like later final fantasy games . each round you choose all commands your characters , then watch round battle take place . it simple , but isn't always fun . mainly because final fantasy iii challenge . if you began some later final fantasy games , then this installment may little too difficult . sometimes combat unforgiving , especially when faced bosses attack twice per turn , power take out character single shot . even worse , encounter rate pretty high running away battle often wasted effort because you'll fail so many times trying so . you'll probably get wiped out just trying run battle failing so many times . there several moments when you'll forced battle hours just leveling up . this fine those used old school rpgs , but many rpgs today not put so much emphasis leveling up , it may try your patience after while . it great people looking challenge , least , but some it may bit too steep . job system interesting . you go through game you'll get crystal shards allow your characters use certain jobs . each job its own set abilities learned it . example , white mages specialize healing arts , black mages attack magic red mages little bit both . you've also got other classes like warriors who take damage other party members , thieves who steal much more . there 23 jobs all , possibilities nearly endless . jobs you choose your characters also impact your stats . mages , example , don't lot strength but they excel magic . also , you gain levels , you'll also gain job levels . so it not only important make sure your characters good level , but also good job level . game looks absolutely stunning , least nintendo ds . it far one best looking out there . there some moments where it looks pixilated , but you can't deny game just looks good regardless . movie sequences also really pretty look they run surprisingly well . battle also fantastic . your enemies sport some amazing detail so backgrounds battle . whole , game just looks good . perhaps only fault graphics how restricted animation characters enemies combat . your characters won't physically go up strike enemy . rather they just step forward swing . very similar how final fantasy games nes worked . it strange see , but you'll quickly get used it . thing seems kind strange , though , top screen throughout most game remains blank . all action takes place bottom screen . there few moments when top screen actually displays anything . you'll see world map you travel overworld while you're towns . there certain moments where top screen text , or shows important story sequence , but that usually it . other than , when trumping through dungeons ( you often ) battle ( you also often ) top screen remains blank . there nothing wrong it , but it feels very awkward play nintendo ds game where top screen blank . they could've used it display dungeon maps or enemy information or something . top screen no impact gameplay whatsoever . music game pretty good , though . it not good other games series , there some tunes just aren't great , but music no means bad . there no voice acting game , really , but we let slide . audio wise , game good . final fantasy iii pretty satisfying experience any final fantasy fan looking good challenge , see how far series come . however , it may also shed little too much its old school charm some areas , particularly its unforgiving challenge . still , it worth it final fantasy fans who want see just how far series come . good+finally since heady days arcade favorites such asteroids , pac-man , missile command , people claimed video games help sharpen your reflexes keep you thinking fast . but there never seemed any hard science back it up . over 20 years later , nintendo releasing product nintendo ds squarely aimed hard science , making claim playing brain age : train your brain minutes day " make your brain feel fresh sharp . even though there several good reviews already here , this game already couple years old , i still feel compelled put my two cents my favorite game . i've played number other first person shooters , but no other game comes even close . fact , i trouble playing other fps now because they lack so many things make far cry exceptional . this game definitely not everyone though . if you more interested shoot-em-up alien games like doom , or story-driven puzzle solving shooters like half life , then you may not like far cry . if , however , you like me , prefer strategic , calculated shooters without too much fluff , then far cry definitely game you . so what makes far cry unique ? large scale , graphics , level design , balance come mind . i still not seen game better overall graphics . levels huge open-ended , giving you freedom plan your approach . this gives game plenty replayability - there numerous effective strategies each level - well enabling each individual player use his or her own style . game hard , it uses checkpoint system , so there little margin error . normally i'd like option quicksave , but far cry checkpoint system works very well . quicksave system would ruin open-endedness game . more difficult levels , exposing yourself enemy fire spells rapid death . game close realistic this regard any i've seen . even easiest level , however , far cry no walk park . ai smart , uses strategy . it doesn't just rush you blindly , unless odds its favor . first level anything but tutorial , action starts quickly . game long , but contrary what reviewer said , i never found it repetitive , i've replayed it twice . levels distinct , each its unique challenges . this brings us gameplay - what separates far cry every other shooter market . may opinion , far cry perfect this aspect game . first all , vehicles play important role game . unlike many games , if you see something , you use it . there multiple boats , trucks , hang-glider - even forklift - each its place its benefits . then there weapons system . all guns far cry useful , well balanced . you carry four weapons , which again , me , perfect number . just enough add variety , but not so many make game totally unrealistic or so few it becomes annoying . this brings me controls . this area where far cry beats out every other fps , my opinion . you come equipped binoculars , which track your enemies , essential component gameplay . you stealth meter so you know when enemies becoming aware your movements . instead just always running , you find yourself stealthily crouching avoid enemies . last , but definitely not least , you crawl . i no idea why this isn't implemented more games . crawling provides you most stealth , steadies your aim considerably . since there only few places game where you run guns blazing expect stay alive , crawling vital your survival . you lean fire same time . i also never seen these two combined game - i think all games should this feature . so , conclusion , this far my favorite shooter , if you like any same kinds things i , then you should buy this game immediately . its only weakness it requires fairly good system run smoothly , number large patches . if you like exploring beautiful environments , spending time planning your approach , making full use your range controls regular basis , then i highly recommend this game . it intricate very challenging . just writing this review makes me look forward playing it fourth time	1

or answers . not case here , where missions seem intense , purpose forthright , unknown lurks deeper than imagined . there places we traveled this game i didn't think existed " halo " playing field . further more than i original . this sequel game you could turn volume up your surround system fully enjoy explosions , swooping incoming enemy ships , well appropriately placed voice moments . anyone loves hear illustrious voice david cross yelling quips quandaries you you destroy any elite , than this perfect game you ! it just felt like more icing already sweet cake . weapons , voices , similar fight aged weapons . this sequel compelled me move forward into deeper unknown . but , again ... it wasn't perfect . while i attest everyone " halo 2 " million times better than pathetic strong man/machine ... i strongly believe he could both , which put me into some tougher situations sometimes . finally , why there timed limit arbiter remain cloaked ? these may seem like small exception . bungie took opportunity grow this empire give us view this " war " dual angle , making universal terror greater more relevant . i enjoyed this game beginning struggled ending , all i can't get enough okami ! i've beaten it am started second play-though . any action-rpg game fan least try this game ! title basically says it all . it typically japanese play words , since , depending how you translate it , " okami " mean either " wolf " or " king gods " . those people whom not enough information really understand game , here basics : 100 years before game beginning , huge 8-headed dragon monster called orochi menaced small village kamiki . after suffering orochi tyranny years , village champion , nagi , white wolf village dubbed shiranui , defeated orochi . shiranui died his wounds after fight , village built shrine him . peace reigned 100 years , until evil suddenly mysteriously reappeared ... you control shiranui reborn quest save land evil . you travel all over land nippon ( which japanese " japan " ; how original ) fighting monsters , helping people , healing nature curse evil . story nothing new , both very linear quite predictable . but it very well , mixing japanese mythology into classic hero story , generous helping humor give it flavor . story one major downside , though : it told through cut scenes contain bucket-loads exposition . you often find yourself button-mashing desperately try speed things , not work very well because important cut scenes don't let you speed up dialogue . instance , very first cut scene opens game literally takes least 15 minutes get through before you get action . most rest not nearly long , but several them take good 5 minutes least . say it gets tedious understatement . still , cell-shaded graphics largely make up tedious cut scenes . they very beautiful , yet simplistic style evokes traditional japanese ink painting . despite simple style , though , level detail outstanding . fact , it so detailed there occasional spot graphical slowdown . this game really pushes hardware ps2 its limits . music sound also fantastic . most music evokes traditional japanese art much graphics , while sound effects range wolf barks footfalls wind blowing gently through trees , more . mood always set perfectly whatever environment you're visiting . except , possibly , voices . rather than real voices , people talk form gibberish sounds like someone trying talk underwater . while it not bother me personally , some people simply not listen these voice effects . either you'll hate voice noises passion , or you won't care all . either way , this not good point game . controls take bit getting used , but when you gotten used them they become second nature . unlike " legend zelda " games , there no enemy lock-on during combat . instead , you automatically target closest monster(s ) when you push attack button . this simplifies combat without turning it into button-mashing cake walk . it works perfectly ... unless you get hit controller bug . yes , * bug * game . thankfully rare , i only encountered it twice 60+ hours game play . still , when it happens it extremely annoying . during combat , while you're wailing away monster , options-menu suddenly open no reason . usually , analog control your controller also go crazy , either just turning off or madly flickering off . either case makes game impossible play , course , since you control your in-game avatar left analog stick . first case easy fix ; just turn analog control back exit menu . second case , you only fix it literally unplugging controller then plugging it back . far more common than controller bug load times . they usually not terrible , but it seems like loading screen comes up least every five minutes or so . these long cut-scenes , you might sometimes wonder if there actually any game play included . but there * * game play , it lot fun . there great deal keep you occupied , compelling story line many treasure hunts , races , puzzles , mini-games . fighting save world , you go fishing , feed animals , catch thieves , lot more . plus , after you beat game once it unlocks lots extras , including image galleries sound track . all wonderful atmosphere definitely make this game worth checking out . rent it before you buy it , if possible , make sure you deal long cut scenes , numerous load times , weird voice effects . but if you fan action rpgs like " legend zelda " , you definitely want add okami your game library . summary : pros : - great story- great graphics- great music/sound- wonderful atmosphere- lots culture mythology give it flavor- plentiful activities mini-games- unlockable extras after beating gamecons : - occasional graphic slowdown- too much exposition- tedious cut-scenes- lots load times- rare controller bugneutral : - voice noises you might or might not hateover-all score : five stars fun-fun-fun ! but three stars over all because many problems	1

which this case actually prequel - announced so i could finally experience what i missed out first time one form or . granted , vp2 not complete carbon copy original , but majority gameplay elements cross game/generation gap , so essence this game should probably give you idea what original itself like . so , would i say i blown away or impressed what i missed out missing original vp ? not really . start , game simply beautiful . there some dazzling effects , leaves grass waving breeze various types weather pounding some locals . this what one should expect last generation ps2 title . sure , every once while battle camera might clip some polygons so it looks like your characters standing air , but so minor it doesn't matter . only gripe i i wish characters weapons changed depending what they currently equipped . however , since character designs so dependant default look weaponry , above simply wouldn't work very well . combat valkyrie claim fame , much like it other tri-ace games like star ocean . this good thing , considering amount time you'll spend battle mode leveling up game massive number characters ( which only handful actually involved story , others just seem there ) . quick glance , battle system seems button mashers dream , but like good 3d fighting series ( soul caliber or tekken ) those who know what their doing always get further or less difficulty things difficult enough . other combat related issues also sprout up : reviving ally requires you near ally body status effects so not your friend - especially when whole party inflicted once ( especially poison ) * shutter * . fun combat , there quite few hitches aware , such wasting ap dash getting nowhere because your party caught edge " something " environment or when party members become separated same reason , limiting your attack options until you take time go back get them . this becomes especially aggravating when you're trying finish battles quickly efficiently possible receive experience crystal bonuses . change 2d fighting environment vp 3d one vp2 works , but above issues make you yearn 2d battles original which would probably devoid these problems . game skill system area initially seems interesting clever but quickly becomes quite cumbersome . you'll form rune words your equipment accessories unlock new " potential " skills . note word " potential " previous sentence . unlocking new skill doesn't grant character skill automatically - only though battle skill used permanently learned . first glance this good thing since it prevents abuse ( think ffix skill system here ) , but player then quickly finds out it " may " ( well , usually ) take long learn said skill . instead awarded set amount points towards your skills after enemy defeat like most normal rpgs , percentage earned towards potential skills based average level your current party enemy(s ) . because this you'll constantly seeking out stronger stronger enemies you'll hardly ever find " undeniable great place " level up . you'll also contending never ending equipping unequipping equipment while doing this often means your party usually far wearing strongest available equipment all times - something usually given most rpgs . traversing dungeons probably most noteworthy aspect vp2 after battle system . first few complete cakewalk teach you ropes , later ones really test you sanity your brainpower . correct sealstone usage photon know-how go long way towards completely clearing them all their contents . kudos tri-ace awesome auto map feature - features like this need become industry/genre standard ! sound department , motoi sakuraba makes rather subdued yet solid entrance , seeming ditch his rather unique yet unorthodox style composing . it not until much later until you hear piece you know " yeah , that sakuraba , no doubt " . voice-overs good , but same time just few tiers above decent . valkyrie profile 2 also falls victim problems prevalent other tri-ace games . some moments unbalanced gameplay creep up player difficulty goes up few notches without much warning . story once again slow start ( this even surprise anymore tri-ace games ? ) , some story twists you see coming mile away ( one revelation end chapter 3 so freaking obvious ! ) . all this said valkyrie profile 2 worth playing if you've never experienced vp ? yes . however , now experienced it , i honestly think i could waited price drop instead buying it day it came out . despite this , i still look forward playing re-release original psp .	1

your enemies other . first it seems like battles take place real time , but reality , enemy only moves when you move . this gives you more than enough time plan out strategy . each enemy attack zone . if you're it , you'll attacked . most rpgs getting attacked no big deal . valkyrie profile 2 it much more than just big deal . difficulty this game escalates really fast . you'll quickly find yourself overwhelmed some your enemies . luckily there solution . most battles leader . if you defeat leader you win automatically without worry defeating others . it helps if you want end battle quickly , especially helps when your party decimated . still , battle system calls complete strategy your part . they say it takes 40 hours complete valkyrie profile 2 . however , you'll find yourself spending most these hours leveling up take new challenges . i mentioned , difficulty level rises fast . meaning you'll probably lot battling dungeon before moving next . even worse , you'll backtrack out dungeon once you complete it . even worse than , enemies respawn when you reenter room . good thing this least , dungeons aren't overly long . again , however , you'll spend quite some time leveling up . addition inside battle , outside battle just interesting dungeons . you'll often come across sealstones . when you pick them up they grant enhancements your party . they either positive or negative . example your strength could go up grabbing one ... go down grabbing . carrying it puts effect your party . however , you also put effect your enemies setting stone dais . needless say , you'll want put negative effects your enemies ... unless you're looking harder challenge than game already . outside dungeons battles you learn plenty skills throughout game . when you buy equipment , you link it together give your characters special skills . this lot fun play around . although , it should said , it gets tedious set it up after while . game shows you which skills you've created through your equipment , but there no way it auto-equip stuff gives you skill . first this no problem , but then your characters start build up your list gets longer , it becomes pain set up all these skills again . it comes down way too much time menu when there shouldn't . valkyrie profile 2 overall pretty satisfying game . if you get past sluggish story ( which really turn out really good end ) then you'll find yourself love this game . it different first one , but not so much old fans find themselves disappointed . actually it quite opposite . if you liked first game , then all means , pick up this one . good+an interesting story+beautiful graphics+excellent music score+good voice acting+large cast playable characters+interesting skill system+just all out fun playthe bad-the story slow-really steep difficulty level , lot game no doubt come you spending time leveling up dungeons before moving on-the skill system interesting , but not able your equipment auto-equip really third installment since rebirth classic series presumably final chapter " sands time " saga , " two thrones " takes best elements " sands time " ( game one ) " warrior within " ( its sequel ) caps franchise style , finesse , gameplay sharp scimitar blade . you once again assume mantle nameless prince persia . returning home babylon long last find it ruins its people war army sand monsters , prince also finds himself company old friends ... old enemies . cursed , he comes find his body soul split two , periodically his wicked self , known dark prince , rises forth wreak havoc take control prince body . storyline entertaining , its characters more developed than most video games , it strikes nice balance darkness light-heartedness ... something " warrior within " failed achieve . essence , it what you would get if you took tone presentation games one two rolled them together . mentioned before , gameplay not far either . while " sands time " set tone its acrobatic platforming , which remains pretty much tact , " warrior within " took game weak combat mechanics fleshed them out into something little more interesting . happily , both elements retained improved upon this new installment . what more , " tenchu " -like stealth kills now available . while they're far perfectly executed ( sometimes they seem unresponsive ) , they nonetheless offer fresh twist opportunity avoid hand-to-hand combat many circumstances . dark prince significant addition . regularly , throughout course game , prince transforms into this alter-ego - sand monster version himself able use weapon called daggertail . this weapon functions much like belmont whip " castelvania " game , allowing dark prince attack his enemies also swing poles light fixtures access new areas prince couldn't hope reach . while stronger than prince combat , unfortunately dark prince he must sustain himself constant supply sand power or succumb death when it all used up . makes these portions game more intense , , rare occasions , little more frustrating . also new series chariot trials , sequences during which prince must escape via horse-drawn wagons through hazardous environments full speed ahead . while they provide nice change pace when they actually occur , they relatively few trial error nature them lead irritation . there only few glaring flaws " thrones . " sound effects ambient music retain their inconsistent , buggy feel . too often dialogue sputters repeats like broken record , music kind fades departs little rhyme or reason . well , graphics suffer some pretty blatant clipping problems . engine aged pretty gracefully , but it aged - least character designs architecture go long way keep you distracted occasional failings visuals . " prince persia : two thrones " , many respects , very similar game two come before it . therefore it not novel first game longtime followers , but it doesn't feel long tooth it might this stage thanks new gameplay additions entertaining continuation story . it certainly better game than " warrior within , " more welcoming almost every way . this series lot life it , " two thrones " well worth your time effort .	1

gameplay , that where final fantasy excels most . final fantasy iv before it , final fantasy uses atb battle system . all your characters stand one side screen while all enemies stand other . when character atb gauge fills up , you'll able issue commands . game then plays out turn based fashion . final fantasy simple , yet it lot fun , it also provides challenge . gameplay enhanced even more games complex job system . job system extremely complex , even todays standards . you progress through game you'll obtain job classes your characters . there plenty jobs . monks , thieves , white mages , black mages , plenty more . each them learn several different abilities all which useful you your journey . when you select job certain character , you'll battle earn ability points so they learn all abilities they . some abilities more useful than others , possibilities endless . also , once character learns ability , you change jobs them equip it . so black mage could , fact , use white magic , provided he learned ability it . you'll spend lot time field battling get ability points . more abilities you learn , more ability points you'll need next . this fine all , but most enemies don't give up loads ability points . so game puts huge emphasis battling . this also seen low amounts experience enemies also give off . leveling up slow process . good news battling fun , especially job system place . unless everyone jobs same , there nearly endless possibility commands you give middle battle . final fantasy advance sports same extras all previous final fantasy re-releases gba . extra dungeons some extra bosses , that it . nothing too big , but worth price nonetheless . it'll probably take you 20-30 hours complete final fantasy . it not filled brim secrets like future final fantasy titles , but mastering all jobs really keep you busy several hours alone . it also cool because extra dungeons bosses , you'll get four new job classes . this only adds more already complex gameplay . graphically , final fantasy little dated , even gba standards . it looks far better than it final fantasy anthology . it much smoother little bit update , but it doesn't go extra mile it could've . enemies still only flash attack your characters , they're hardly animated . least game great soundtrack . final fantasy goes show why super nintendo era final fantasy music how you follow up runaway success like 2001 grand theft auto iii ? rockstar north responded year later gta : vice city , game took gameplay its predecessor expanded it considerably . same time , vice city gave series extensive amazing stylistic makeover , drenching experience sights , sounds , attitude miami , florida mid ' 80s . so where you go there ? you take it statewide . grand theft auto : san andreas expands series ' concept encompass three entire cities , well countryside them . gameplay similarly expands , packing some explosive set pieces amazing action-movie-like thrills while maintaining same remarkably fun , freefom gta feel . short , rockstar it again . san andreas definitely lives up grand theft auto name . fact , it arguably best game series . just when you think you're getting used gang warfare , everything goes sour . we're certainly not interested spoiling game many interesting plot twists , so we'll leave out details , but it should suffice say you'll eventually need get heck out los santos . you wind up country outside city , where you'll encounter many more great characters officially embark your quest put right what gone wrong . once you get out los santos , you won't really worry gang warfare while , game settles down into more gta-like feel . like previous games series , san andreas features fairly linear story takes you through game areas . you'll start off restricted los santos -- something story justifies claiming earthquake taken out bridges roads link los santos surrounding area -- but it doesn't take long unlock other two areas . game also throws some pretty great surprises form characters previous entries series . these characters tie gta games together really nicely , so while san andreas feels pretty different other games series , it still feels like you're playing same universe . game also tracks lot other statistics . respect big one , it what you'll earning most you complete missions . not all missions earn you money , but almost all them good slight respect bonus . higher respect rating lets you recruit more more gang members follow you around shoot rival gangs , which new addition nice perk , but not something comes handy very often . you're also rated lot different vehicle categories , like driving , riding motorcycles , bicycling , piloting aircraft . you use vehicle , your skill it slowly increases , which seems tighten up controls bit . case motorcycles , it also makes it less likely you'll fly off bike wreck . your bicycling skills translate into higher bunny hops . similarly , you're given stats every type firearm game . you'll start poor skills all weapons , but don't let tag " poor " fool you--cj skills feel roughly same tommy vercetti when you first squeeze trigger . after getting some time weapon , you'll upgrade it " gangster " level , which extends your lock-on range weapon , speeds up reloading , some cases lets you walk around while locked . upgrading your skill weapon highest level , " hitman , " takes relatively long time , but it extends lock-on range speeds up reloading even further , it also opens up ability dual-wield some one-handed weapons . unloading two full clips submachine-gun ammo extremely satisfying here . just like all gta games , thing makes gta go up over , freedom walk around huge map doing whatever hell you want . you dont just missions , half fun wandering around killing people ! usually , when game tries million different things , it overambitious hodge-podge can't manage get its different parts down cold . grand theft auto : san andreas you doing many , many more things than any previous gta game , while some them work little better than others , strength all these different gameplay elements -- too many count -- makes powerful package not disappoint , despite extremely high standards grand theft auto established san andreas needed live up . its strong story , well-written dialogue , terrific voice cast , impressive graphics , great in-game sound , extremely entertaining varied gameplay , grand theft auto : san andreas stupendous thrill ride shouldn't missed .	1

even though there several good reviews already here , this game already couple years old , i still feel compelled put my two cents my favorite game . i've played number other first person shooters , but no other game comes even close . fact , i trouble playing other fps now because they lack so many things make far cry exceptional . this game definitely not everyone though . if you more interested shoot-em-up alien games like doom , or story-driven puzzle solving shooters like half life , then you may not like far cry . if , however , you like me , prefer strategic , calculated shooters without too much fluff , then far cry definitely game you . so what makes far cry unique ? large scale , graphics , level design , balance come mind . i still not seen game better overall graphics . levels huge open-ended , giving you freedom plan your approach . this gives game plenty replayability - there numerous effective strategies each level - well enabling each individual player use his or her own style . game hard , it uses checkpoint system , so there little margin error . normally i'd like option quicksave , but far cry checkpoint system works very well . quicksave system would ruin open-endedness game . more difficult levels , exposing yourself enemy fire spells rapid death . game close realistic this regard any i've seen . even easiest level , however , far cry no walk park . ai smart , uses strategy . it doesn't just rush you blindly , unless odds its favor . first level anything but tutorial , action starts quickly . game long , but contrary what reviewer said , i never found it repetitive , i've replayed it twice . levels distinct , each its unique challenges . this brings us gameplay - what separates far cry every other shooter market . may opinion , far cry perfect this aspect game . first all , vehicles play important role game . unlike many games , if you see something , you use it . there multiple boats , trucks , hang-glider - even forklift - each its place its benefits . then there weapons system . all guns far cry useful , well balanced . you carry four weapons , which again , me , perfect number . just enough add variety , but not so many make game totally unrealistic or so few it becomes annoying . this brings me controls . this area where far cry beats out every other fps , my opinion . you come equipped binoculars , which track your enemies , essential component gameplay . you stealth meter so you know when enemies becoming aware your movements . instead just always running , you find yourself stealthily crouching avoid enemies . last , but definitely not least , you crawl . i no idea why this isn't implemented more games . crawling provides you most stealth , steadies your aim considerably . since there only few places game where you run guns blazing expect stay alive , crawling vital your survival . you lean fire same time . i also never seen these two combined game - i think all games should this feature . so , conclusion , this far my favorite shooter , if you like any same kinds things i , then you should buy this game immediately . its only weakness it requires fairly good system run smoothly , number large patches . if you like exploring beautiful environments , spending time planning your approach , making full use your range controls regular basis , then i highly recommend this game . it intricate very challenging . just writing this review makes me look forward playing it fourth time	1

, por probar que tan buenas eran las graficas el gameplay . al principio no me pareci� gran cosa ... pero cuando sales la primera vez campo abierto ... incre�ble ! te quita el aliento . una vez como enclave , incluso los fans de los juegos de sigilo como splinter cell , encontraran aqu� algo para ellos . camino la gloria ---------------------- es4 : oblivion te coloca en el rol de un prisionero , que por alguna raz�n , fuiste parte de un sue�o del emperador uriel septim en el cual tu eras el elegido para salvar tamriel de un oscuro grupo daedra conocido como mythic dawn . de esta forma empiezas vagar por las catacumbas ayudando los guardias proteger al emperador , sin embargo el emperador es asesinado tu eres la unica esperanza de detener este culto cerrar las puertas de games ds . subtitle here simply workable way include letters title game , seems requirement platform this point . dawn sorrow actually takes place year after events aria sorrow , which came out 2003 game boy advance . if you've played game -- or if you've played just any recent castlevania game actually--you'll right home dawn sorrow , because it basically same game repackaged fit ds . isn't bad thing though , because castlevania games long carried torch good , old-fashioned 2d side-scrolling gameplay , dawn sorrow keeps flame burning bright ever . star dawn sorrow soma cruz , young adventurer who narrowly avoided becoming next dracula aria sorrow . soma ability collect souls monsters he kills , thus inheriting their powers . year after soma escaped dracula castle , mysterious woman named celia shows up attacks him . celia priestess new cult attempting resurrect dracula . since soma already proved once before he capable foiling resurrection dark lord , cult decides eliminate him before he mess up their plans well . soma survives attack quite easily celia forced retreat . apparently soma doesn't take kindly people who try kill him , so he sets out find celia prevent her reviving dracula . entire game takes place cult base , which replica dracula castle . true castlevania form you'll start off relatively weak , only knife some mediocre armor . you progress through areas castle , you'll fight monsters search mazelike hallways where you'll gain experience , well find new better equipment . you gain experience , you'll level up your stats increase attack , defense , strength , constitution , intelligence , luck . throughout game you'll also collect souls monsters you kill . these souls equipped give soma new abilities . there three types souls you equip , well ability-type souls grant you special powers without equip them . ability souls collected when you defeat bosses , these abilities usually required progress through game . using these ability souls soma learn how double-jump , move underwater , break crystal blocks -- all which required access certain areas castle . castlevania : dawn sorrow sticks close tried-and-true formula , so it instant hit anyone affinity sort explorative gameplay series known . while it doesn't much distinguish itself first castlevania ds , updated look , excellent music , added controls help refine series even further . bottom line : whether you're familiar series or not , you can't go wrong dawn sorrow .	1

which this case actually prequel - announced so i could finally experience what i missed out first time one form or . granted , vp2 not complete carbon copy original , but majority gameplay elements cross game/generation gap , so essence this game should probably give you idea what original itself like . so , would i say i blown away or impressed what i missed out missing original vp ? not really . start , game simply beautiful . there some dazzling effects , leaves grass waving breeze various types weather pounding some locals . this what one should expect last generation ps2 title . sure , every once while battle camera might clip some polygons so it looks like your characters standing air , but so minor it doesn't matter . only gripe i i wish characters weapons changed depending what they currently equipped . however , since character designs so dependant default look weaponry , above simply wouldn't work very well . combat valkyrie claim fame , much like it other tri-ace games like star ocean . this good thing , considering amount time you'll spend battle mode leveling up game massive number characters ( which only handful actually involved story , others just seem there ) . quick glance , battle system seems button mashers dream , but like good 3d fighting series ( soul caliber or tekken ) those who know what their doing always get further or less difficulty things difficult enough . other combat related issues also sprout up : reviving ally requires you near ally body status effects so not your friend - especially when whole party inflicted once ( especially poison ) * shutter * . fun combat , there quite few hitches aware , such wasting ap dash getting nowhere because your party caught edge " something " environment or when party members become separated same reason , limiting your attack options until you take time go back get them . this becomes especially aggravating when you're trying finish battles quickly efficiently possible receive experience crystal bonuses . change 2d fighting environment vp 3d one vp2 works , but above issues make you yearn 2d battles original which would probably devoid these problems . game skill system area initially seems interesting clever but quickly becomes quite cumbersome . you'll form rune words your equipment accessories unlock new " potential " skills . note word " potential " previous sentence . unlocking new skill doesn't grant character skill automatically - only though battle skill used permanently learned . first glance this good thing since it prevents abuse ( think ffix skill system here ) , but player then quickly finds out it " may " ( well , usually ) take long learn said skill . instead awarded set amount points towards your skills after enemy defeat like most normal rpgs , percentage earned towards potential skills based average level your current party enemy(s ) . because this you'll constantly seeking out stronger stronger enemies you'll hardly ever find " undeniable great place " level up . you'll also contending never ending equipping unequipping equipment while doing this often means your party usually far wearing strongest available equipment all times - something usually given most rpgs . traversing dungeons probably most noteworthy aspect vp2 after battle system . first few complete cakewalk teach you ropes , later ones really test you sanity your brainpower . correct sealstone usage photon know-how go long way towards completely clearing them all their contents . kudos tri-ace awesome auto map feature - features like this need become industry/genre standard ! sound department , motoi sakuraba makes rather subdued yet solid entrance , seeming ditch his rather unique yet unorthodox style composing . it not until much later until you hear piece you know " yeah , that sakuraba , no doubt " . voice-overs good , but same time just few tiers above decent . valkyrie profile 2 also falls victim problems prevalent other tri-ace games . some moments unbalanced gameplay creep up player difficulty goes up few notches without much warning . story once again slow start ( this even surprise anymore tri-ace games ? ) , some story twists you see coming mile away ( one revelation end chapter 3 so freaking obvious ! ) . all this said valkyrie profile 2 worth playing if you've never experienced vp ? yes . however , now experienced it , i honestly think i could waited price drop instead buying it day it came out . despite this , i still look forward playing re-release original psp .	1

masterpiece " . truly what it , masterpiece , because its seamless integration stealth tactics adventurous action . there no other games genre offer style gameplay splinter cell offers . it unique gaming experience you play believe . core gameplay heart splinter cell revolutionary , style never put into game before . game puts you boots american super-spy agent sam fisher . fisher , you go deep behind enemy lines operate top-secret covert operations . you must remain hidden not seen or captured , otherwise u.s. government claim no knowledge your existence . you gain experience operating super-spy , you soon learn opening fire enemies making noise only cause alarm raised , which simply put all your enemies high-alert probably get you killed soon enough . so instead run-and-gun gameplay , splinter cell forces you use stealth tactics , which pretty much means stick shadows avoid seen ; if you must kill your enemies complete your mission objectives , sure it silently . order silently eliminate enemies , you must sneak up them without making noise . then , after grabbing them , you option interrogating them or forcing them cooperate you , then you either kill them or knock them out . it seems like simple concept , but it lot harder than it seems . you won't just able blaze through levels complete your objectives matter minutes . missions extremely challenging you end up replaying missions again again . order survive , you must learn how operate silently dark without seen or detected . this when splinter cell stunningly amazing graphics come handy . not only characters game each meticulously detailed ultra-realistic physics true-to-life animations , but environments extremely realistic full life . shadow effects one main highlights game . not only they there looks , but they actually directly integrated into core gameplay . they actually necessity your survival , they help you remain hidden invisible enemy . overall , graphics stunningly amazing look unbelievably realistic extremely true-to-life . sound simply icing cake . it brings amazing gameplay stunning graphics life . ubisoft always company known take full advantage dolby 5.1 , splinter cell no exception , especially surround sound . game shows off every single sound , fisher tip-toeing dark pop your silenced pistol pounding enemy fire shot fisher , it all simply unbelievably realistic . first , i skeptical purchasing this game because i didn't think i would like its stealth based gameplay , considering i more halo fan . but much contrary , i absolutely no problem paying $50 this game when i purchased it when it first released because hours enjoyment i got out it , hours fun i still get out it today . bargain price anywhere $10 $20 definitely worth money . even though there aren't whole lot features game besides outstanding single player campaign , it still definitely worth money considering how many hours enjoyment you get out splinter cell . splinter cell amazing story running throughout campaign . it really pulls action together really makes it worth playing . you find yourself tearing through missions just see what going happen next story . this makes splinter cell one those rare addicting games never leave your xbox console until you complete i t.t om clancy splinter cell unique experience no other games compare . it truly one kind game so revolutionary its gameplay i honestly call it masterpiece . stunningly amazing gameplay combined its extremely realistic graphics it true life sounds , tom clancy splinter cell amazing stealth action game changed way people look video games .	1

soldiers . surprise somewhat disappointing performance artificial intelligence . most humanoid enemies don't seem show same kind intelligent behavior they original , even tougher difficulty levels . part elder scrolls series , morrowind takes live action adventure games like zelda series overlays it more traditional role playing stat system ala dungeons dragons . elaborate , player freely explore expansive 3d world first person or third person mode , while practicing improving their character skill set . combat , example , rather than trying work your way through menu system trying cast magic use attack moves etc . ( final fantasy anyone ? ) , player must physically aim swing sword or fire spell his opponent . whether or not bow lands based things like player agility bad guy block skill . thus , unlike game such , say , fable , action doesn't depend much player own reflexes dexterity . little common sense caution goes long way . also , don't expect lots elaborate , teary-eyed cut scenes like story-driven games such final fantasy . real draw this game complete freedom player whoever they want , go anywhere they like , almost anything ( within reason ) . player asked choose name , race , gender , face hairstyle their character , also create basic skill set use ( any combination combat , magical , stealth categories ) . then player given some simple instructions beginning first task main quest simply released into massive world towns , people , wilderness . there main quest follow , but gameplay completely open-ended . it easy become completely distracted caught up endless guild quests random adventures await your character . personally , i've playing this game two half years now , i've still not accomplished everything there this game . i'm not sure i even describe depth this game this review . i've literally spent hours just trying different clothes armor , creating my own spells potions , or reading books ( both factual fictional ) game libraries ( i'd like add almost anything read book found or game ) . i've also spent literally days gameplay searching various legendary unique artifacts trying uncover various mysteries game , such solving disappearance dwarves , finding cure vampirism , locating ( or becoming ) werewolf , how become necromancer ( some which i've found or am close finding ) . i've played most ( if not all ) zelda games , i've played fable , i've played games like dragon warrior final fantasy , i've even played text rpg like adom . they all their good points advantages ( i've greatly enjoyed them all ) , but none them ( not even majora mask ) held my attention this long . elder scrolls iii : morrowind best role playing game i've ever played maybe ( just maybe ) best game i've ever played overall	1

you fight your way map map . unlike other rpg games , your hero won't able go it alone ; defeat foes lay their path , he/she call upon power armies six different races : human , elves , dwarves , orcs , trolls , dark elves . your avatar must find structures known rune monuments access his/her unique power using runes summon forth rune heroes armies . rpg element game limited essentially character you create beginning . your avatar , rune warrior , remnant powerful heroes served circle mages during time convocation . avatar completely under your control ; you choose name , equipment , gender , distribute skill points stat points they gain levels create unique character . you create punishing melee fighter , powerful sorcerer , deadeye archer , or any combination those other concepts . your avatar also summon rune heroes he/she goes ; these heroes other rune warriors whose levels classes fixed , so all you equip them best available items . you progress through game , you find more powerful hero runes summon better heroes hero monuments . rts element continuation system started warcraft , but few twists . you must find rune monument one six races ( human monument , dwarf monument , etc . ) , possess appropriate worker rune , building plans , unit plans summon army . once you summon your workers , they gather resources build necessary structures summon army . need appropriate building unit plans occasionally necessitates fully exploring each map , so not miss any . levels your military units depends level worker rune you used summon your workers , so you find higher-level worker runes your units gain levels become stronger . heart winter shadow phoenix help add dozens hours original order dawn campaign , granting you access higher levels , more powerful equipment , new heroes , more advanced units . one my favorites " walking fortress " troll unit hurls massive boulders enemy structures . you import your avatar order dawn into both expansions , allowing this hero complete epic adventure . shadow phoenix very challenging some most ridiculous boss fights i ever seen . several them require your avatar , rune heroes , full army bring down single foe . heart winter excellent continuation order dawn , adding new friends enemies , shadow phoenix harrowing challenging test strategy patience your rune hero moves towards their ultimate destiny . sum it up , this dvd plenty adventurous rts/rpg action wrapped around engrossing fantasy yarn should provide dozens hours quality entertainment . highly recommended .	1
nintendo ds lite ( 2006 . ) introduction : late 2004 , nintendo premiered nintendo dual screen , or nintendo ds short . despite skepticism many critics fans alike , new console quickly won audiences over . it nintendo best handheld console date . 2006 , nintendo released smaller , lighter version system , appropriately called ds lite . overview : nintendo released ds lite mid 2006 . new version system smaller than old version , features repositioned buttons/switches/etc , variable brightness levels , few other changes classic ds . it retails $130.00 comes three colors - white , black , pink . review : nintendo good job revising ds . many problems older version system fixed . here some highlights flaws new version . -the good- -smaller more compact than original ds . original ds rather bulky comparison some other handhelds market , it kind pain haul around . finally , we've got smaller , lighter version system easily transported . -variable brightness levels . you adjust brightness your liking this version ds . brighter levels use more battery power , lower levels use less , so you plan out how best use your battery life . -features clip game boy advance slot . unlike original ds , lite version includes clip goes slot where game boy advance games fit . this helps give system streamlined appearance , it keeps slot cleaner . -compatible e-reader . old ds , due its shape , couldn't use e-reader accessory . lite model shape better all around , it use it ! -available three cool colors . whether you want white , black , or pink , there color everyone . -repositioned buttons things . nintendo made system more convenient use moving buttons around spots easier use . -redesigned stylus . new stylus bigger thicker than ones old ds , all-around improvement . -compatible older ds . since it basically same system , you won't any compatibility issues . -the bad- -smaller isn't necessarily better every way . i big hands they fit old ds fine . shrinking it actually makes it little harder , some aspects , use all buttons . -still not compatible pre-game boy advance games . course i wasn't really expecting nintendo fix this . -still not compatible game boy advance multiplayer . thing i wasn't expecting fixed . overall : overall this nice improvement over original ds . there problems , but most part , just same problems original . if you haven't gotten ds yet , definitely go lite model . edition notes : ds lite relatively new should stores years come .	1

completely different without considering its gameplay battle system alterations . final fantasy iii isn't easy game . it doesn't really hold your hand any point , it'll ruthlessly punish those unfortunate gamers who tread off suggested path . still , it got classic hook , hook that almost impossible describe but even harder avoid once it snagged you . final fantasy iii keeps four-person party standard its two original predecessors also traditional turn-based battle system . result system forces you really think your actions each turn because enemy going attack no matter what their agility or speed parameters . if refia running low hp you suspect possible group attack boss character , it would wise cast healing spell maybe even prepare phoenix down . it would nice see squareenix black magic spell like fire take one point away your level one magic points , while level three one like fira takes away one level three magic point . no matter what spell you use , it takes away single point . i don't like this system much , because it doesn't give much importance or power each spell . example , level three white magic spells cura teleport given same point value , which doesn't make sense when cura used least fifty times often teleport throughout game . this seems good place mention menu system , which also quite dated sometimes not easy use newer entries . because dated mp system , there numbers all over place it seems little sloppy . new story here job system . surely if you've gaming internet page or read gaming magazine last few months , you've seen final fantasy iii ads state it offers 279,841 unique party combinations , four characters 23 different jobs . if you don't believe it , grab your nearest graphing calculator figure up equation factorials . beginning , every character possesses neutral ( undeveloped ) freelancer job . you find interact more powerful crystals throughout storyline , you'll unlock more jobs develop your party even further . you warrior , thief , monk , black , red , or white mage early game eventually you'll unlock jobs like geomancer , dark knight , dragoon , summoner ninja . once you choose job , you power it up increasing its job level ; value unique each job each individual character . example , it possible luneth level 15 freelancer , level 25 warrior , level 30 dark knight before end game . these levels , course , separate character base level , which , always , increases experience points earned random battles boosts your general stats . more than anything , final fantasy iii good way introduce foreign chapter series long-term players series veterans . i wasn't surprised when , after 30-minute trek through cave , i killed two turns boss character forced tread long path all over again . it unfortunate so much backtracking required , but even after dying second time same boss using same annoying attack , i picked game back up . i trudged through it despite my bitterness enjoyed every second it . classic rpgs like final fantasy iii didn't introduce save points or crystals found later games ; only save point overworld map . here , game saved any point . big challenge comes when status-changing magic wreaks havoc your party . unlike recent rpgs , where negative status often eliminated after battle , almost every single status ailment final fantasy iii remains afterward . poison , paralysis , confusion , frog-all these familiar effects lot more familiar time players see ending credits . unseasoned rpg players probably quite frustrated , know every time you see enemy use attack " bad breath , " you're quite lot trouble . final fantasy iii one best-looking ds games date . squareenix introduced visual style that reminiscent final fantasy vii final fantasy : crystal chronicles . result game very colorful detailed . spell effects impressive one could expect ds trump those some console games . boss monster models fun look defeat . i would liked see some more animation during battle ; rather than running up attacking enemies , like final fantasy , characters stand place swing their weapons classic rpg style . it would really nice see squareenix go those extra two miles ( they already went one reworking graphics ) but what here great . music seems standard rpg fare , i'm not totally sure whether or not tunes high-quality rips classic nes midi , but what here sounds pretty nice . least there unforgettable nine-note victory tune ; that'll always get smile out final fantasy fan . final fantasy iii serves its purpose introducing unknown chapter fans doing so very respectable fashion . there things could better , sure . squareenix could put little more time modernizing battle system , animation , menus , save system . would put two cherries top sweet , tasty treat . even all these little kinks , final fantasy iii great . it got classic replay value . it got punishing challenge appeal fans older games . it got production values topped only amazon . ca --------- action replay max more than just video game enhancer ( vge ) .... or least it claims . my version quite old yet but it claims include region-free dvd player memory card compression utility ( squeeze more saves onto your memory card ) . i not used either these features personally , but i heard horror stories memory manager corrupting gamesaves whole memory cards ; some reusable , some permanently damaged . this fact you must load up action replay software access saves use memory manager turned me off using it . however , real reason i bought armax its codes i'll get those second . armax , like newer gamesharks , loads its software cd . this major annoyance me . every time you load game you must insert armax memory card ( which i don't know what ) cd , go sit couch wait software load , choose your codes , then get up put actual game dvd wait it load . you can't simply turn your ps2 go sit down . old days cartridge gaming you would snap vge game console so you could turn console go sit down . early generation gamesharks little box would attach expansion slot ps1 or n64 it . if you wanted it load before game , you turned its switch . even if armax perfect every other way ( it not , btw ) , it would get maximum 4 stars long you boot it cd first . i mean , why can't memory card part it least hold codes even just current game you're playing after system shut off or reset so you don't load software every @mn time . ok , rant over . codes . user interface armax better than gameshark . functionally , they very similar course , but armax just feels cleaner easier use . it offers beginner interface includes descriptions code functions ( not user-entered ones though , if i remember right ) , more robust expert mode . big advantage , theory , armax over gameshark its ability update itself using your ps2 broadband connection . upshot you download new codes your favorite games fairly quickly instead manually typing them all using controller . dark cloud go this silver lining you no control over which codes you download ;
